edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.editors
Class ConsistencyChecker

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.editors.ConsistencyChecker

public class ConsistencyChecker
extends java.lang.Object

It is a requirement that each element of a given type have a unique name. The name is used as a primary key for the database tables so if duplicate names are entered very bad things happen. This is a utility class that checks to see if an item with a given name is already in the database.

This probably should have been implemented as a static class that did the database check to avoid the overhead of creating all these new objects each time a comparision needs to be done. Then again, the object creation overhead is probably negligible compared to the DB query.

Author:
yue

Method Detail

check

public boolean check(boolean showDialog)
This method does the actual check using the data sent to it in the constructor. If the class was a static you could just pass that information in here and only have the one call.

Returns:
true if the name is not a duplicate

check

public boolean check()
Version of the check method that doesn't take a boolean value. Added for compatibility. Simply calls the other method with showDialog set to true.
